page.title: 07EDUCATION
page.content: An elderly resident of Camerton recalls her schooldays when the village school was the only one attended from 5-13. On leaving, boys took up farmwork or mining, girls service at Camerton Court. There were three classrooms each heated with a fire at one end. It was often so cold that pupils warmed their hands on hot baked potatoes brought for their lunch. The annual treat for the children was a visit to Camerton Court they would roll down the banks, run races and eagerly consume cakes and drinks, filling their aprons and pockets for the rest of their families.
